Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; rosette in added white outline and added red dots in petals and at centre; below, trace of two white bands; top of lip glazed; exterior: at rim, z band between pairs of lines; below, painted decoration consisting of tail, possibly belonging to sphinx to left; at right, face of second sphinx to left; very large pendant triangle as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding interior and exterior decoration, see British Museum 1924,1201.264. Lemos describes 1924,1201.264 as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Mature Animal Style. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 981). Given the similarities between both sherds, 1924,1201.580 can be added to this group.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 263, no. 549)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0460) (phase 2)
